Class minesweeper

java.lang.Object
  minesweeper
public class minesweeper
extends java.lang.Object

minesweeper class provides the data
and methods for a minesweeper game

Level 1 - data & methods to implement
Mines, Clues, Tiles, basic Board characters,
and opening/marking tiles

Level 2 - Additional data & methods to support game status
Game status and extended Board characters

minesweeper.java
spring 2004

Field Summary
 int[][] mines
          stores mine and clue values, 9 - mine, 0-8 clue values
private  java.lang.String status
          Level 2 Requirement - game status "win", "lose", "play"
 int[][] tiles
          stores tile values 0 - open, 1 - closed, 2 - question, 3 - mine
 
Constructor Summary
minesweeper()
          default constructor
calls initGame method to set-up game with 9 by 9 game board
minesweeper(int newRows, int newCols)
          alternate constructor use specifies board size
calls initGame method to set-up game with newRows by newCols game board
 
Method Summary
private  void calculateClues()
          calculates clue values and updates clue values in mines array
integer value 9 represents a mine
clue values will be 0 ... 8
private  boolean gameWon()
          Level 2 - game won status
 char getBoard(int r, int c)
          determines the current game board character for r,c position using the value of the mines[][] and tiles[][]array.  The character returned for Level2 will vary depending on the game status.

Level 1 Requirements
‘X’             Closed tile
‘ ‘               Open tile, zero adjacent mines
‘1’...’8’      Open tile, number indicates number of adjacent mines
‘?’             Closed tile, set as question mark
‘F’             Closed tile, flagged as mine
‘*’             Open tile, mine

Level 2 Requirements
'!'             Mine that loses game (after game lost)
'-'             Flagged mine that was incorrectly marked (after game lost)
'F'            All mines (after game won)
 int getCols()
          number of columns for game board
 int getMines(int r, int c)
          value of the mines array at r,c
-1 is returned if invalid r,c
 int getRows()
          number of rows for game board
 java.lang.String getStatus()
          Level 2 - game status "win", "lose", "play"
 int getTiles(int r, int c)
          value of the tiles array at r,c -1 is returned if invalid r,c
private  void initGame(int newRows, int newCols)
          set up mines and tiles arrays and game status

create mines and tile arrays of size newRows by newCols
place mines in array
calculate clues
Level 2 Requirement - set game status to "play"
 void markTile(int r, int c, int t)
          mark tile - open tile, close tile, flag tile as mine, set tile as question mark, close tile Level 1 - Requirements
- invalid r,c values must be ignored
- a tile that is opened must stay open
- a tile that is marked as a flag (ie. tile[][] value 3) can not be opened

Level 2 - Requirements
- tile values can only change when game status is "play"
- game status must be updated after a tile is opened
private  void placeMines()
          places mines randomly on grid integer value 9 represents a mine
number of mines = 1 + (number of columns * number rows) / 10
minimum number of mines = 1
private  void resetTiles()
          Sets all tiles to 1 - closed
 java.lang.String toStringBoard()
          game board array as String formatted for console output
 java.lang.String toStringMines()
          mines array as String formatted for console output
 java.lang.String toStringTiles()
          tiles array as String formatted for console output
private  boolean validIndex(int x, int y)
          determines if x,y is valid position for current board
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

                    int c)

getTiles

public int getTiles(int r,
                    int c)
value of the tiles array at r,c -1 is returned if invalid r,c

Parameters:
r - row index
c - column index
Returns:
value of tiles array, -1 if invalid

markTile

public void markTile(int r,
                     int c,
                     int t)
mark tile - open tile, close tile, flag tile as mine, set tile as question mark, close tile

Level 1 - Requirements
- invalid r,c values must be ignored
- a tile that is opened must stay open
- a tile that is marked as a flag (ie. tile[][] value 3) can not be opened

Level 2 - Requirements
- tile values can only change when game status is "play"
- game status must be updated after a tile is opened

Parameters:
r - row index
c - column index
t - 0 - open, 1 - close, 2 - question, 3 - mine

toStringMines

public java.lang.String toStringMines()
mines array as String

Returns:
mines array as a String

toStringTiles

public java.lang.String toStringTiles()
tiles array as String formatted for console output

Returns:
mines array as a String

toStringBoard

public java.lang.String toStringBoard()
game board array as String  formatted for console output

Returns:
game board as String

getBoard

public char getBoard(int r,
                     int c)
          determines the current game board character for r,c position using the value of the mines[][] and tiles[][]array.  The character returned for Level2 will vary depending on the game status.

Level 1 Requirements
‘X’             Closed tile
‘ ‘               Open tile, zero adjacent mines
‘1’...’8’      Open tile, number indicates number of adjacent mines
‘?’             Closed tile, set as question mark
‘F’             Closed tile, flagged as mine
‘*’             Open tile, mine

Level 2 Requirements
'!'             Mine that loses game (after game lost)
'-'             Flagged mine that was incorrectly marked (after game lost)
'F'            All mines (after game won)
 
Returns:
char representing game board at r,c

initGame

private void initGame(int newRows,
                      int newCols)

          set up mines and tiles arrays and game status

create mines and tile arrays of size newRows by newCols
place mines in array
calculate clues

Level 2 Requirement
set game status to "play"

Parameters:
newRows - number of rows for grid
newCols - number of columns for grid

resetTiles

private void resetTiles()
Sets all tiles to 1 - closed

placeMines

private void placeMines()
places mines randomly on grid
integer value 9 represents a mine
number of mines = 1 +( number of columns * number rows) / 10
each mine must be placed at a unique position
minimum number of mines = 1

calculateClues

private void calculateClues()
calculates clue values and updates clue values in mines array
integer value 9 represents a mine
clue values will be 0 ... 8

validIndex

private boolean validIndex(int x,
                           int y)
determines if x,y is valid position for board

Parameters:
x - row index
y - column index
Returns:
true if valid position on board, false if not valid board position

gameWon

private boolean gameWon()
Level 2 - game won status

Returns:
true if game won false if game not won
